{{also|schliessen}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|schliessen}} {{qualifier|Switzerland|Liechtenstein}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|slieȥen}}, from {{inh|de|goh|sliozan}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*sleutaną}}. Akin to Old Saxon {{m|osx|slūtan}}, Dutch {{m|nl|sluiten}}, English {{m|en|slot}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈʃliːsn̩]|[ˈʃliːsən]}} * {{audio|de|De-schließen.ogg|Audio}} * {{audio|de|De-at-schließen.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=2|schließt|schloss|geschlossen|past subjunctive=schlösse}} # {{lb|de|transitive|or|intransitive}} to [[shut]]; to [[close]]; to [[shut down]] # {{lb|de|transitive|or|intransitive}} to [[lock]] # {{lb|de|transitive|or|intransitive}} to [[conclude]]; to [[end]]; to [[close]] # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[come]] to (an agreement); to enter into (a relationship); to [[reach]] (a settlement) # {{lb|de|transitive|or|intransitive}} to [[gather]]; to [[conclude]]; to come to realize ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-irr-schließen}} Before the 1996 German spelling reform, the past tense forms were {{m|de|schloß}} and {{m|de|schloßt}}, while the reform spellings are {{m|de|schloss}} and {{m|de|schlosst}}. ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|zumachen}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|aufmachen}} * {{l|de|öffnen}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top3}} * {{l|de|abschließen}} * {{l|de|anschließen}} * {{l|de|aufschließen}} * {{l|de|ausschließen}} * {{l|de|beschließen}} {{der-mid3}} * {{l|de|einschließen}} * {{l|de|entschließen}} * {{l|de|erschließen}} * {{l|de|schließbar}} {{der-mid3}} * {{l|de|Schließfach}} * {{l|de|Schließung}} * {{l|de|umschließen}} * {{l|de|verschließen}} * {{l|de|zuschließen}} {{der-bottom}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|schließlich}} * {{l|de|Schloss}} * {{l|de|Schluss}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
